I'd love to see more golems, I think the reason they lost though is the utility factor. Now both had very cool maintenance/cool-down features I believe should be used in making golems that have more utility. Say a fishing golem, that periodically sleeps on the job, or a Farming one you have to restock with stacks of seeds or derust. Both the copper and tuff were at best some random signal generators or quirky decor so it's not a surprise they lost the votes.

Or tweak the idea from the Glare, and have a golem that wonders on the edge of the torch light (level 1 or nearest wall path) and will growl at nearby hostiles. Players can lead it with a leash, however, if in the dark without a light source it acts cowardly, aka doesn't growl at monsters. No attack feature nearly a guard dog. That would have utility and would be really handy for a buildable verse findable mob.
It has killed me that the copper golem didn't win the final vote. It would've given a greater use to copper as well as use in redstone circuitry and decoration as a statue.
I‚Äôm fine with just the copper golem but both are welcome

I really like the idea of Phantom Nests, but I think the Phantoms whole kinda deal is Insomnia. Maybe the Nests would only be active once the 3 Day Timer is done? There also should be more incentive to seek out and kill Phantoms, like some cool crystal similar to Amethyst that is in their nests alongside Phantoms, and are only obtainable when the player mining them has Insomnia. Maybe call this the "Nightmare Crystal", it could let you make items that let you control your Insomnia or other Items that make it so Sleeping isn't objectively the best answer (Saturation after not sleeping, Better Cat Gifts, etc).

Yas you got my vote! But what if there is a new phantom boss there. Like in one out of ten nests, it‚Äôs there. It can be a larger phantom called the ‚Äúqueen phantom‚Äù that lays the eggs. Attacks include 1, lullaby, and it gives you 3 seconds of blindness and slowness. 2, wing blast, blasts you away from it. 3, swarm, summons 2 or 3 phantoms that are smaller and weaker, Mabel slower? They would be baby‚Äôs and they don‚Äôt do much.

Pretty cool this- to add onto it, Phantom nests would occur in the shallow caves atop mountains. As for the insomnia bit, I really think that needs to remain- there are simple ways to make it less annoying & more interesting on that front.

Phantom Flag

It can be crafted from a phantom membrane and two wind wands. When placed above a bell in a village, the villagers will no longer want to trade and will hide in their houses. While the flag is above the bell, every night the village will be attacked by phantoms. Their goal is to kill all available iron golems. Building a golem in a cage won‚Äôt help, as it will be out of their reach and they won‚Äôt be able to access it. During the raid, golems do not respawn.

The raid lasts 5 minutes, and if during that time the phantoms defeat all the golems, the phantom flag does not wither. However, if at least one golem survives until the end of the raid, the flag withers, villagers resume trading, and the player receives the ‚ÄúHero of the Village‚Äù effect. But if you fail to protect the golems and they all die, the raid will repeat the next night, though the golems will respawn during the day.

Phantoms do not react to cats in the village, which is unnatural since they are normally afraid of cats, but the flag disables that fear.

Cool! Honestly this is a good idea, but what would its use be? Would it protect you from damage like an actual shield would?

Verdict: Idea has potential, and I have voted for it, but please go into detail as to the use of the mob.

Other details

  • The Shyeld would have five hearts, but will only take damage when it's head or body is exposed. It can be healed by giving it magma cream.
  • The Shyeld wouldn‚Äôt take fire damage and can also float over lava.
  • The Shyeld would be able to extend its shields up to 2 blocks away from its body.
  • The shields would leave the body (leaving a small trail of smoke behind, also leaving itself exposed to attack), for about 5 seconds then the shield would come back to its body.
  • When it feels threatened nearby mobs. It would spin around rapidly, extending its shields, pushing most nearby mobs away. Followed by it quickly getting away.
  • If it was tamed The Shyeld would follow the player around.
  • If the player is being attacked The Shyeld would use it shields to protect (Using its shields to protect you) giving the player time to run, attack, or eat.
  • It will move all 4 of its shields in front of you (Protecting you from damage), when the shield is attacked, they will be deactivated and would go back to its body (Giving it 10 seconds)
  • When protecting the player, The Shyeld can be subject to attack.
  • When the player wants The Shyeld to sit, they just have to right click and The Shyeld would slowly fall to the ground, where it would sit and look around.
  • If exposed to water, The Shyeld would slowly take damage. (If submerged, the damage would happen a lot faster) (It would try it's best to avoid water)
  • If you killed it it wouldn't drop anything, but it dies while defending you it can drop its shields

I think it‚Äôd be a cool idea! It could also serve as a hint to new players who don‚Äôt know snow golems can be built. It would also increase the threat of traveling in those biomes. Appearance wise, in order to achieve the cursed-like effect maybe have it emit the enchantment table particles and give its eyes a purple hue?

I like your idea. Here are some other ideas that could make your idea better.

The regular snow golems could have a very rare chance to replace a cursed snow golem. The cursed snow golem could also have a chance to spawn with a pumpkin head. Since the cursed snow golem is bad, the regular snow golem can actually deal damage to the cursed snow golem. This could encourage players to have a snow golem defense in snowy biomes.

This is a really cool idea, because most mobs can't spawn on snow anyways, so this would add the necessary threat level to the snowy biomes.

I think as a drop they could also drop carved pumpkins or carrots.
Adding this could also add a potion effect to reverse it. It could also be used in reverting zombie villagers.
That is a good idea, and maybe you could mix that potion with different ores to make potions for different ores
